101.80.text:

someone sent us this

118.39.text: they had almost the same joke.

And neither of us were working
because it was all like Maxim

couple years, got

156.85.text:
dropped by my commercial

And then out of nowhere,
like Kate and I were just

161.89.text: We were like, what is happening?

It didn't last that

166.15.text:

at UCB, and then

177.12.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: We just became
like these weird soul mate

179.44.text:
I don't even know

Like Kate's boyfriend, who

184.15.text:
on the way home, he's like you

And Kate says she

And then we found out that

194.92.text:

And so then we're just like,

and it was a musical, and

evolved because we've found

We'll have like a 20

we've ever thought

And then she gives it to me,

a first pass of the
lyrics give it to Kate,

she does the first

do you guys have ever

go on like a specific bit of
like you want to hit a joke,

and then a song

279.56.text:
If there's not enough to sustain

Because some things are

because we can't blow

567.10.text:
When you're like fuck

570.70.text:

and you're on this

and 33, but we're

1008.20.text: like nah, that's not as funny.

1010.35.text:
But she's like I just know
everything's going to get bad,

1012.44.text: and I got to meet someone soon.

1013.73.text:
And she was so
pretty, and I was OK.

1016.49.text:
Sorry, maybe you shouldn't
watch that video.

1021.39.text:
CLIFF LUNGARETTI:
That's said, out of all

1023.10.text:
of the songs you and
Kate have put together,

1026.68.text:
Like which is your
favorite baby, basically?

1029.38.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: My
favorite song is one

1032.17.text:
It's just on an album,
but it was on our TV show.

1034.21.text:
It's called "Such a
Loser," and it's an anthem

1038.72.text:
Because just like you
guys are on the internet.

1041.75.text:
You understand when you
put something out there,

1043.77.text: you just get all this criticism.

1045.92.text:
And it feels like there's
like this hierarchy where

1048.66.text:
it's winners, people who
just don't do anything

1052.52.text:
but comment on it,
and then losers.

1054.23.text:
But we just feel like
those should be switched.

1056.19.text:
Like winners are just like they
won, you got it like they did.

1058.71.text:
But the people who try and
the people who comment on it,

1060.93.text:
should be like a
different hierarchy.

1062.48.text:
So that the commenters
should just be like whatever.

1065.02.text:
And so we wrote a song
in praise of people

1067.50.text:
who are trying and failing
because if you're failing that

1071.77.text: So it's not a funny song.

1072.81.text:
It's totally
sentimental, but I think

1074.35.text:
it's the best thing
we've ever written.

1079.50.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: We have
a cartoon made of it,

1081.91.text:
and people play
it for their kids.

1083.57.text:
CLIFF LUNGARETTI: With
your songwriting process,

1085.57.text:
you seem to then
also go into video.

1089.23.text:
Do you ever get bogged
down in like, oh, this

1092.64.text:
would look great visually, so
we should add it to the song?

1095.41.text: Or is that well after the fact?

1097.08.text:
We don't have that
kind of forethought.

1098.78.text:
We're just like,
oh, I don't know.

1099.97.text:
I guess we'll just
film some stuff.

1101.43.text:
Yeah, we don't really ever think
about that part of the song.

1103.97.text:
And like for "Such
a Loser," we had

1105.43.text:
it animated by these people in
Boston, who are so incredible.

1108.05.text:
And they just sent us this
thing, and Kate and I,

1110.09.text: we always have a million notes.

1111.39.text:
We're so nit-picky, it takes us
forever for us to do anything.

1113.97.text:
And they sent it, and we just
started crying, both of us.

1116.34.text: And we're like this is perfect.

1117.94.text:
And they were,
well, we have like

1120.56.text: And we're like no, love it.

1122.89.text:
So sometimes it's
like that easy.

1124.31.text:
CLIFF LUNGARETTI:
I was going to say,

1125.85.text:
so for you, notes are really
a bad thing in general.

1128.98.text: I always have so many notes.

1130.98.text: But this one, it was perfect.

1132.98.text:
And so you don't want to-- if
it's perfect, it's perfect.

1137.89.text:
But yeah, I'm like pretty
hands-on with everything.

1140.93.text:
I like to be in every
moment of everything.

1143.07.text:
Like Natasha and I are editing
"Another Period" right now,

1145.49.text:
and we're in the editing
room from like 10:00 to 8:00,

1149.04.text:
We just get our
nails done in there.

1157.98.text:
Sorry, I thought I
was getting signaled.

1160.11.text:
In "Another Period" coming up,
what can we look forward to?

1162.79.text:
You mentioned that
Jermaine's going to be on.

1164.32.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: Jermaine,
and Andrew Reynolds

1166.15.text:
is on this new season, playing
like a dashing prince-type

1170.84.text:
Harriet Tubman is
in our premiere,

1173.93.text:
which is so crazy that
now she's on money-- well,

1176.32.text:
about to be on money--
because we have her

1178.40.text: as a-- she's a branding expert.

1180.61.text:
We have her as like
this Oprah-type person,

1182.47.text:
and she's basically
like how do you

1183.93.text:
think I'm the only
name associated

1187.61.text:
She's like, I did that
shit, like on our show.

1189.68.text:
People are going to have
mixed reactions to it,

1191.64.text:
they really are, and
we're prepared for that.

1193.70.text: But it is funny if you watch.

1196.75.text:
Because you think about
it how did one person--

1199.54.text: Like there was so many people.

1201.42.text:
But yeah, so you just
think through history.

1203.89.text:
And now, she's going to be
on money so guess it worked.

1206.76.text:
CLIFF LUNGARETTI: In that
vein, you mentioned earlier

1208.97.text:
that a lot of things are from
1902, and then you "yes, and."

1213.33.text: So much stuff is true though.

1215.25.text:
People think we
make up this stuff.

1216.71.text:
Like we have cocaine wine,
that was just a popular drink.

1221.59.text:
People had cocaine
wine all the time.

1223.20.text:
Just those kind of
things are just real.

1226.35.text:
Freud masturbating
people, it's just real.

1229.26.text:
CLIFF LUNGARETTI: So that's a
real clip entirely with Freud?

1233.20.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: Yes, that
was not Chris Parnell.

1239.48.text:
Thank you so much for being
here, we really appreciate--

1241.24.text:
RIKI LINDHOME:
Thanks for having me.

1241.72.text:
If anyone would like to
meet Riki afterwards,

1246.34.text:
If you didn't want to ask
your questions directly.

1249.11.text:
Thank you so much
for being here.

1250.48.text:
RIKI LINDHOME: Thank
you for having me.
